info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 7:55PM EDT until July 15 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh NC
info.description:
FFWRAH
The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Forsyth County in central North Carolina...
* Until 1100 PM EDT.
* At 755 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms building westward and producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen across eastern portions of the county and should continue to spread west. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Winston-Salem, High Point, Kernersville, Clemmons, Lewisville, Walkertown, Rural Hall, Pfafftown, Stanleyville, Sedge Garden, Donnaha, Belews Creek and Belews Lake.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 11:00 PM EDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 11:00 PM EDT. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 11:00 PM EDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 11:00 PM EDT. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
